meanings.definition: Calm, quiet, or composed in manner
meanings.sent1: The sedate cat napped peacefully in the sun.
meanings.sent2: She always remained sedate during stressful situations.
meanings.sent3: The sedate librarian surprised everyone with her karaoke skills.
meanings.sent4: The sedate lake mirrored the stillness of the surrounding forest.
meanings.sent5: His sedate demeanor made him a calming presence in the room.

meanings.sent1: The nurse will sedate the patient before the surgery.
meanings.sent2: They decided to sedate the anxious dog before grooming.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to sedate the audience with his boring tricks.
meanings.sent4: She needed to sedate her nerves before the big presentation.
meanings.sent5: The doctor will sedate the child before the dental procedure.
